channel.title: Origin of private servers?
channel.description: ok i was just thinking and thought well how were they able to make this?... like wouldnt someone have to steal all of the data from jagex? Just asking if anyone how this ever got started

item.title: Origin of private servers?
item.dc:creator: @cocoa cocoa
item.description:
@cocoa wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:6, topic:230884”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=304005.msg2438501#msg2438501 date=1221342572]
winterLove wrote the first publicly released server, as there was servers built before him. You are all using winterLove’s base, when he doesn’t want you to. He wanted to enhance our ability to emulate RuneScape by just providing an example.
[/quote]So winterLove never meant to really steal anything from jagex, just provide and example of what we could create from it…?[/quote]

he did mean to steal stuff from jagex still. But yes it was an example of what could happen yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Origin of private servers?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:6, topic:230884”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=304005.msg2438501#msg2438501 date=1221342572]
winterLove wrote the first publicly released server, as there was servers built before him. You are all using winterLove’s base, when he doesn’t want you to. He wanted to enhance our ability to emulate RuneScape by just providing an example.
[/quote]So winterLove never meant to really steal anything from jagex, just provide and example of what we could create from it…?[/quote]
He never stole anything from JaGex, all he did was download the JAR from RuneScape’s website, deobfuscate it and rename it, sniffed out packets, and wrote a server for it.

Read full topic

@hidendra wrote:

the servers were made from scratch (excluding cryption and stream classes (stolen from Jagex clients)), the clients and cache stolen.
